name: complex
posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: involving a lot of different but related parts
trans_examp.trans_cn: 由许多相关的不同部分组成的；构造复杂的

example.egtrans: 复杂的分子／碳水化合物

example.eg: The company has a complex organizational structure.
example.egtrans: 公司组织结构非常复杂。

trans_examp.trans_en: difficult to understand or find an answer to because of having many different parts
trans_examp.trans_cn: 难懂的，费解的；错综复杂的

example.eg: It's a very complex issue to which there is no straightforward answer.
example.egtrans: 这个问题错综复杂，没有简单直接的答案。

example.eg: The film's plot was so complex that I couldn't follow it.
example.egtrans: 这部电影的情节太复杂，我看不懂。

name: complex
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: complex
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a large building with various connected rooms or a related group of buildings

example.eg: They live in a large apartment complex.
example.egtrans: 他们住在一幢大型的公寓楼里。

dsense.name: complex
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular anxiety or unconscious fear that a person has, especially as a result of an unpleasant experience that they have had in the past or because they have a low opinion of their own worth
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指由过去的不快经历或自我评价不高造成的）情结，心理负担，病态心理

example.eg: I think he's got a complex about being bald.
example.egtrans: 我觉得他因谢顶而有心理负担。

example.eg: Don't go on about her weight - you'll give her a complex!
example.egtrans: 别再没完没了地谈她的体重了——你会让她有心理负担的！
